def.dt: :a room with a sink and toilet and usually a bathtub or shower Their house has three bathrooms. In U.S. English, a bathroom is mainly thought of as a room with a toilet. In British English, a bathroom is mainly thought of as a room with a bathtub or shower.
:a room in a public place with a toilet and sink The restaurant has only one bathroom. a public bathroom [=restroom, lavatory]
:to use the toilet The little boy told his mother that he had to go to the bathroom. You should use the bathroom before we leave.
